sentences: Rataste, vankri nägin. Vankrikoorem veeres näginaga, näginal kodu poole.
Igas asjas oldi ühemeelelised, aeti ilma vähema näginata päevast päeva.
context: The word 'nägin' is the past tense first person singular form of the Estonian verb 'nägima', which means 'to see'. It indicates that someone saw or viewed something in the past. The related forms include 'näginaga' (with seeing) and 'näginata' (without seeing), showing how this root word can be modified with suffixes to create different grammatical constructions.
